title: Wireless System Automation and Test Engineer
summary: Do you have a passion for taking on big challenges? Do you love pushing the limits of what’s considered feasible? As part of our Wireless Hardware group, you’ll be responsible for bringing groundbreaking wireless connectivity to the world. On this team, you’ll help improve the performance of our products through innovative system-on-chip designs. You and your team will build platform architecture that paves the way for all-new experiences, including the ones that allow people to take advantage of our innovations in sensor technology. Together, our goal is to ensure nothing stands in the way of our customers’ connections with their devices. Join us and help build world-renowned wireless systems that connect customers to their world like never before.
description: You will be part of the dynamic and innovative Wireless/PHY System DVT team! The team is responsible for ensuring the Wireless/PHY system meets the design specification and functions correctly. The design specifications and functionalities include EVM, Sensitivity, Desense, RF/Baseband Performance, MIMO, Beamforming, and Coexistence. You will be responsible for automation development and verification of the Wireless/PHY Systems. You will also develop the test and test infrastructure for the validation and regression at the center of a silicon design group on the radio and PHY. You will work with PHY/MAC/RF design engineers and system integration/test engine
key_qualifications:
Knowledge in wireless communication systems: WiFi and/or Cellular Technologies Understanding of key performance indicators and impairments of RF and Baseband signals
Experience testing wireless silicon in a lab
Experience using and understanding lab equipment: signal analyzer, signal generator, spectrum analyzer Experience with Python, Shell scripting, and/or C/C++/C#
Experience developing test automation, including equipment drivers, debug tools, automation scripts, interfaces Experience with automation infrastructure development (traceability, repeatability) and related tools (GIT, CI/CD, database, reporting tools)
education_experience: Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering +3 years of relevant experience. Masters preferred
